name: Pokemon with stats
data_intro: This data set includes 721 Pokemon, including their number, name, first and second type, and basic stats: HP, Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed. It has been of great use when teaching statistics to kids. With certain types you can also give a geeky introduction to machine learning.

cat_feature_intro.Name: - **Name**: Name of each pokemon
cat_feature_intro.Type 1: - **Type 1**: Each pokemon has a type, this determines weakness/resistance to attacks
cat_feature_intro.Type 2: - **Type 2**: Some pokemon are dual type and have 2

num_feature_intro.Total: - **Total**: sum of all stats that come after this, a general guide to how strong a pokemon is
num_feature_intro.HP: - **HP**: hit points, or health, defines how much damage a pokemon can withstand before fainting
num_feature_intro.Attack: One question has been answered with this database: The type of a pokemon cannot be inferred only by it's Attack and Deffence. It would be worthy to find which two variables can define the type of a pokemon, if any. Two variables can be plotted in a 2D space, and used as an example for machine learning. This could mean the creation of a visual example any geeky Machine Learning class would love.
num_feature_intro.Defense: - **Defense**: the base damage resistance against normal attacks
num_feature_intro.Speed: - **Speed**: determines which pokemon attacks first each round
